page.title: 14Tavistock Police
page.content: Tavistock police station is built into the remains of{Tavistock Abbey,} and is one of the oldest buildings anywhere, still being used by the police. There are offices for interviewing people, storing records, photographing criminals and a police rest room. Until recently police lived here. The{Dartmoor Rescue}store has equipment to help find people injured on Dartmoor, or escaped prisoners from Princetown prison. The{Magistrates' Court}is a replica of an old bailey court in London.It is held every Friday and covers all West Devon.{Burglary}is the most common crime, concentrated on the industrial estates, shops and the Down Road area. There are many more road accidents in summer when Tavistock is crowded with tourists. There is one{Community {Policeman}for Tavistock.
